messages: a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (19:48): how to make one samba share available to anyone without password?
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (19:48): or even username
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (19:48): I mean regardles username and password share should work
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (19:49): guest ok = yes didn't work
0fd8687af2876ebef2cc09d227cc6e71 (19:49): hi all
0fd8687af2876ebef2cc09d227cc6e71 (19:50): i have problems to mount one share in windows named "Mi m?sica"
0fd8687af2876ebef2cc09d227cc6e71 (19:50): the problem .. i guess is for the ? character..
0fd8687af2876ebef2cc09d227cc6e71 (19:51): can i do some thing to mount that share ?
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (19:59): so it looks that even security = shared does not help to have anonymous folder shared with no password
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (20:21): dm: ok I did it according to example in URL you gave me
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (20:21): i can't create any files or folders there
1aabac6d068eef6a7bad3fdf50a05cc8 (20:22): martii you must to check with a ls -la if anyone have access
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (20:23): ok smb looks like running by user root
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (20:24): but tires to access folder with nobody
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (20:25): and I have no such user in system (ubuntu)
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:25): martii: samba starts as root so it can listen on port < 1024, but when you connect to changes the ownership to the user you auth as
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:26): if it's getting "nobody", then you are authing via guest access
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:26): you can change the unix user samba uses for guest with "guest user="
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:27): sfu: there's some nice (if wordy) real world examples in the "making users happy" part of the guide
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (20:28): do i need tu put writable = yes to let nobody user to write?
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (20:28): in my share

49d3650727f25f1831b88d97028cf8b4 (20:28): Every so often users are promted for a username and password when they try and connect to our UNIX system and can't connect. They shouldn't need any password. If the users pc is re-booted it usually resolves the issue. What is the cause and What can be done to resolve this issue.
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (20:29): yep it looks like I have to :)
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:31): martii: writable=no is the default, so yes, no matter what user
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:31): mmh: depends on your auth system
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (20:31): ||cw: thanks :) you're very confident about samba - thank you for all your help
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:31): martii: been using it for about 6 years :)
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (20:32): ||cw: I use it for about the same amount of time but I set it up and forget :)
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (20:32): ||cw: but this time I have different needs so I can't just copy what I have done years before :)
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:32): yeah, and samba has been changing
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:33): which is a good thing
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (20:33): ||cw: it looks like you're dealing with plenty of different configs :)
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:33): I manage 3 domains, all different
a9307337c7dd2b5cb10bc0772679c3cf (20:33): yep samba is very very awsome piece of software
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:33): well, one is a workgroup, with shares also exported via nfs, one nt4 domain, and one ldap+samba domain
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:34): workgroup has guest and auth, which maks things interesting
e77ac59d083c3122535d02ac0d6ae14f (20:35): ||cw < thank you, the manpage look's good, but for no reason i hardly found it :)
e77ac59d083c3122535d02ac0d6ae14f (20:36): ||cw < i though suze (and others, but my client is on suze) have done some tools to help the process, but i can't find them
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:37): sfu: migration basicaly revolves arounf net rpc vampire, and I have not seen any tools to help automate that furthure

e77ac59d083c3122535d02ac0d6ae14f (20:39): i know mandriva did one a while ago to move some french administration from nt to nux, but i still don't know if it work only on mandriva and if the "rpc-vampire" is enought
e77ac59d083c3122535d02ac0d6ae14f (20:39): but thank's
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (20:40): guys i have a linux box here im trying to setup so i can auth against windows AD server
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (20:40): im trying to use winbind to join the domain but i get the error
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (20:41): net rpc join -S PDC -U Administrator
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (20:41): Unable to find a suitable server
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:46): k31th: i think it's net ads join
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (20:46): ||cw: tried that to
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:46): and I don't think -S is what your want
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:46): you need to specify the domain, not the server
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:46): i think
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:46): I haven't actualy done ADS, so it's all just i recall reading
e77ac59d083c3122535d02ac0d6ae14f (20:46): padbol < could you give me an information on a mandriva tool please ?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:47): sfu: he left 5 min a ago
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:47): oh n/m
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:47): sfu: IIRC, there's a couple other tools as well, one to migrate printers
e77ac59d083c3122535d02ac0d6ae14f (20:47): ||cw < damned
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (20:48): ||cw: should i add the machine account in ad bofore trying thi
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (20:48): im trying to add it to a windows dc 2003
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:48): k31th: shouldn't have to, i think
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:48): k31th: did you setup kerberos?
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (20:48): ||cw: no
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:49): i think that's needed, again, not sure
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (20:49): http://rafb.net/paste/results/P2OzzO47.html
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (20:49): the howto's should cover all this
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (20:49): ||cw: looks that way
e77ac59d083c3122535d02ac0d6ae14f (21:12): thank you for your help, have a nice time :)

fae6f2d53ba7f89985cbb0d0bc751fe7 (21:13): Hello folks, I am trying to get winbind+samba to authenticate against my Active Directory domain. I can get a kerberos ticket, and I can join the machine to the domain, but logins at the console and over SSH don't work. I get "incorrect password or invalid membership" in the auth logs.
1aabac6d068eef6a7bad3fdf50a05cc8 (21:17): how can i migrate froma w2003 pdc to a samba, must i extrack the SId from the windows?

93d5337a7848acdc27cc1688d1b3dcf1 (21:20): I have a directory that is owned by the group "Engineers".  I'd like everything that is copied into or created inside that directory to also be owned by Engineers and not the default group of the person that's doing the copying/creating.  Is that possible?
93d5337a7848acdc27cc1688d1b3dcf1 (21:28): By the way, I'm not sure if Samba can help since this directory is several layers below the top shared directory that needs to be owned by "Domain Users"

c5d86e6147c9a0217c54f6ddc13a9155 (21:34): is there a way (i didn't see) that makes samba serve files sorted? for some there is a media player that doesn't sort itself... and when playing from samba shares ... well ...
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (21:45): wat is the eq to /etc/pam.d/common-account on a centos system ?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (21:45): Worf: it is the client's job to sort.  even ls does its own sorting
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (21:45): as wellas windows explorer
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (21:45): k31th: not all systems use a "common" file aproach
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (21:46): sadly
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (21:46): i see
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (21:46): so wat do i do just look thru all the pam files ?
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (21:47): yeah
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (21:47): of course, you can add a common file if toy want
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (21:47): it's just an include command
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (21:47): well the only howto i cn find that does wat i want is a debian one.
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (21:48): http://www.debian-administration.org/articles/395 half way down page
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (21:48): it asks u to make changes to pam files none of them exsist on a centos box
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (21:48): k31th: you can either modify all the pam files that you want to use winbind, or convert them to the @include common-auth style
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (21:49): if they have a common file, it should be namd in an obvios way
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (21:49): and at least you will see the @include in the other files
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (21:50): im trying to auth against a windows 2003 server
c5d86e6147c9a0217c54f6ddc13a9155 (21:54): ||cw: i totally agree that it's the client's job... i just asked in case there was a way...
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (21:54): ||cw: make any sence of this error ?
34e14de88b65d6b048a1ecaaa8d1ec80 (21:54): http://rafb.net/paste/results/MrcNh361.html

I've already vampired the 2000 server, but I am having trouble demoting it.  dcpromo keeps failing saying that a domain controller cannot be found with an account for it

5f1358f94c3a8a3c4adc1ba149fa3cbd (22:05): I have a baffling problem: If I chmod a file on the Samba server, any Windows boxes that mount that share don't see the change. Ever.  I can unmount and remount the share.  I can reboot the Windows box.  I can reboot the Samba server.  Still, the Windows box does not see the change.  Any suggestions on where to look next?

9f7cb33ad47438d6a7c646269ce477a1 (22:06): I'm afraid that if I tell it that it is the last DC in the ADS domain, that it will screw up the entire domain and make it so no computers can log in anymore.
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (22:06): mishehu: 2k cannot be a bdc to samba
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (22:06): neitehr can nt4
9f7cb33ad47438d6a7c646269ce477a1 (22:06): ||cw: I don't want it to be, I want to demote the 2k server to be a member server
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (22:06): only another samba, and then only with a 3rd party way of account sync
9f7cb33ad47438d6a7c646269ce477a1 (22:07): and then make the samba the pdc
869bc7b89036e2454e91cbfe9faaf52a (22:07): mishehu: can you demote it offline?  unplug it from the lan, promote the samba, demote win2k, then plug it back in

9f7cb33ad47438d6a7c646269ce477a1 (22:08): ||cw: I'll have to image out the machine before I do that.  the catch is that there's an mssql db on the server and I don't know if this will screw that up at all (I don't work with mssql at all).  the mssql db is part of the MIP accounting software.
